### loops & logic


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
1 == 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
1 == 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
c(1, 2, 3) == c(2, 1, 3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
1 == c(2, 1, 3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
1 != 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
1 != 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
1 > 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
5 > 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
3 < 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
3 < 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
c(1, 2 ,3) > c(2, 1, 3)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
1 >= 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
5 >= 1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
3 <= 2
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# is 16 divisible by 4 AND 8
16 %% 4 == 0 & 16 %% 8 == 0
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
16 %% 4 == 0 & 16 %% 3 == 0
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] FALSE
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
16 %% 4 == 0 & 16 %% 8 == 0 & 16 %% 2 == 0
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
16 %% 4 == 0 | 16 %% 8 == 0
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] TRUE
```
:::
:::


### if else statements


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
a <- 1 # defines a to be a 1

if (a == 1) {
  print(a) # this happens if a == 1
} else {
  print("A is not 1") # this happens if a is not 1
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
if (a == 2) {
    print(a)
} else {
  print("Hello world")
  }
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Hello world"
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# for loop

a <- c(1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 1)

for (i in a) {
  
  if (i == 1) {
    print("I'm a 1")
  } else {
    print("I'm not a 1")
  }
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "I'm a 1"
[1] "I'm not a 1"
[1] "I'm a 1"
[1] "I'm not a 1"
[1] "I'm not a 1"
[1] "I'm not a 1"
[1] "I'm a 1"
```
:::
:::


basic syntax - for(){}, for(loop control){ loop steps: iterator \<- vector1 break stops a loop

### while loops


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i <- 1
while (i < 6) {
  print(i)
  i <- i + 1 # adds one each step of loop
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 4
[1] 5
```
:::
:::


### repeat loops


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
i <- 0
repeat {
  i <- i + 1
  print(i)
  if (i == 5) {
    break
  }
}
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1
[1] 2
[1] 3
[1] 4
[1] 5
```
:::
:::


braces not needed on one line
